review: I'm not too crazy about their pizza but I love their salads!  The BBQ Chicken Salad is my favorite.  It has bean, corn, tortilla strips, cheese, tomatoes and of course bbq chicken.  You can choose to add avocado for an extra $2.50.  The Miso Shrimp Salad is also a good choice.  It's a little lighter tasting than the BBQ Chicken Salad.  It has shrimp, edamame, and avocado.   We tried the Korean BBQ Steak Tacos and the White Corn Guacamole + Chips from the small cravings menu.  The steak tacos tasted nothing like Korean BBQ.  The White Corn Guacamole was ok but a bit on the bland side. Overall, I only like this place for their salads and their flavored iced teas.  Oh! And the Cherry Limeade is pretty good too!

I feel it used to be a lot better. food tends to lack here and there, and a bit more expensive for what you get. but its good with groups, family, or what you'd like to make of it. servers are usually very accommodating, and its located in a mall, so you can always shop if there is a wait.

The pizza here is so-so, honestly I'd pick Papa John's pizza over this any day. I tried their Pear and Gorgonzola pizza, and it was thin and lacking in flavor, and just not what good old pizza should taste like :( Although, do keep in mind that I did get it to go for take out and only got the chance to eat it about 20 minutes later, but still. Cold pizza doesn't always have to mean bad pizza. However their hot fudge brownie sundae is good!

CPK is a classic, but this specific location in Montgomery Mall is extra great. They always have a line out the door but do really well in not making you wait tooooo long. I personally love the grilled chicken pizza, but they also make modifications without hesitation- such as a plain pasta with red sauce!

I'd recommend getting the classic caesar salad with ranch dressing. Fantastic and a good filling! The crispy mac n cheese nuggets are too good to put in words!! AMAZING FOOD!! One thing that put me down a star is that it's in the middle of an overcrowded mall.

This was our second visit to this CPK. BP, his mom, and I stopped by for a quick dinner.  I was super exited to try the Korean BBQ Steak tacos, but when they weren't on the menu I explained to the waitress that I saw them online and whether I could order it (as an entree). She came back to the table at least twice just to clarify what I wanted . This should have been my first sign... I asked her each time whether it was okay to order this and when she said it wouldn't be a problem, I was all "Great!"   When the food arrived, BP's mom had a gorgeous salad, BP, had a scrumptious artichoke and chicken pizza and I got an appetizer.... The Korean BBQ Steak Tacos were an appetizer...  First I was very disappointed, but as many know, my eyes are bigger then my stomach and the food was a perfect portion! BP offered me a pizza slice and I even though I was feeling stuffed, I really enjoyed it. There was an ample amount of chicken and the artichoke pieces were flavorful. -1 Star because the service was super slow for a Tuesday (early evening).

Maybe I just have a soft spot for CPK because I'm old enough to remember when the only options for pizza were Sbarro's, Pizza Hut, and the school cafeteria. Then one day, along comes CPK, with their newfangled ideas of bbq sauce and chicken on a pizza. Cray cray, right? My favorite pizza is the four cheese with tomato and basil. The wild mushroom is pretty good too and so is the previously mentioned bbq chicken. And when I'm pretending to be a healthy eater, the veggie pizza hits the spot. I haven't actually sat down to dinner here in years but I get takeout pizzas once every couple of months. They always get my order right and it's ready within the time frame quoted. They throw in bread and butter and utensils because I love free shit. Awesome!

So after having a less than pleasant experience at legal seafood I walk myself over to California pizza kitchen bar and OMG heaven Francs took such good care of me from the second I sat down my drink was nice my food was amazing. Go for it eat here!

I came here yesterday. The service is just excellent here. They were amazingly fast, considering the fact that it was busy and was sitting at the corner. I was in a rush, but the waiter managed to get order and food our in less than 20 minutes. I was able to finish my meal in less than a hour.

Montgomery Mall CPK - oh the memories! Since I was in single digits I've been coming here. With my parents after a movie at the mall, after shopping with friends, or just because I love the food. Stand-outs: Original (it IS the original) bbq chicken chopped salad. Kung Pao Spaghetti. Avocado Egg Rolls. Pea soup. $5 and under new 'tapas' style small plates. Unlike other locations, our server brought us bread without having to ask. Since this is a very busy location (inside a shopping mall), they do push a little on table turnover. And yes, you have people of all ages (including the wee ones who are past nap time...). My water was frequently refilled!!!! (always a plus) All in all, we will be back!

We ordered CPK through Take Out Taxi and the food was a bit mediocre. Pookie got down on his spaghetti and pizza, but the boy is a human garbage disposal, The Tish and I were both a bit underwhelmed. My soup was bland and her pizza was cold, but the egg rolls really stepped it up. If you are ordering in stick to normal pizza, CPK is better in person.

I loved spinach dip and ravioli was so yummy are waiter was okay it's was in the mall so you had to wait about 20 minutes to get seated. But everything else was fast with the food ordering and getting it in our table.

CPK is a chain restaurant that serves, you guessed it, pizza in all varieties and toppings.  As someone who's not a big fan of bread, I'm not a big fan of pizza.  I actually like to go to CPK for their salads (grilled vegetable salad is a fav) and their tequila lime feticcine :-) I don't usually go out of my way for CPK but on that day, Veteran's day, I did.  They were offering free pizza and non-alcoholic beverages for veteran's and active duty service members!!  My fellow miliary peeps and I marched into the restaurant and were accomodated immediately.  We declared our military status and were offered the goods as promised. Was it me or did everything taste better because it was free?!?!  Well things are about to taste even better as the kind GM waltz over to us and offered vouchers for the same deal for fellow military folks.  Like a stack of vouchers!!  That made our day as we had friends who are stuck working at the hospital that day and could not enjoy glorious food deals. The icing on the cake?  The same kind and awesome GM walked by and noticed that we were a tad chilly in our corner.  He said something and actually did something about it!! Thank you CPK!!  You really know how to take care of your soldiers/sailors/airmen and we appreciate it.

Mos notable dish - jambalaya pasta. SO GOOD. Thanks to our blond waiter for the suggestion and thanks Amex for giving me $10 back! Great meal in the burbs with my hometown best friend. It was a four star experience but 3 because it's a franchise and I am a foodie.

4 stars is generous.  The food keeps the rating high.  Everyone likes CPK.  Everyone has their favorite dish at CPK.  But, everyone has their reasons why they hate CPK.   I have had all kind of items off of their menu, from salads to soups (yeah smashed pea & barely!), to strange-sounding but delicious pizzas.  Its the kind of place where you want to finish the entire pizza (its that good), but you don't want to be judged...so you take half home with you.  So good.  My gripes:  1. Prices...wow!  I would come here a lot more often if the menu was just a bit more reasonably priced.   2. The staff always seems upset at one another.  They try to not show it, but you can cut the tension with a knife.  Its like they all hate each other or hate the job or something.  I can't quite describe it other than a pervasive feeling of misery. 3. Why are there always 8 million kids in there?  It doesn't look like anyplace children would enjoy, especially considering the many bottles of wine on display at the entrance.  The 8 million kids also means the place is full of screaming and crying...I never want to stay a second longer than I have to. 4. I've only gotten take-out once, but they made me decide to never try it again.  I ordered soup and a salad.  They asked if I wanted utensils and I said yes.  I didn't receive the soup (strange, because I was charged for it).  I discovered it before leaving the parking lot, so I was able to come back in and get it.  However, I never got those utensils.  Why bother asking?  It wasn't even busy, it was like 4:00 on a weekday afternoon.  If that job is too stressful for the person working the take-out area, find someone else who doesn't cave under the pressure of putting together an order of soup and salad.

It was my first time, so I didn't know what to order. I think I tried the pasta penne, but I couldn't finish it. It wasn't like it tasted bad, but I was sick that day, so I felt bad. Customer service was amazing, they'd always show up every once in a while to check up on you, and I thought that was really sweet. Tha place was also nice and presentable. Very clean too!

Came here on Saturday around 5pm for dinner with my sister. We needed a break from shopping so came to eat dinner here. the restaurant wasn't that busy, we just waited 5 minutes for a table to clear. The hostess took us back to our seats, and the waiter was clearing the table while we waited by our table. They didn't wipe down the table and the table was sticky. I think the previous customers spilled something sweet. I wish the hostess would have given the waiter enough time to clear and  the table properly before seating us.... Okay now to the food, the price is RIDICULOUSLY high. My sister and I ordered the California Veggie Pizza (original crust on honey wheat). The pizza wasn't anything special and didn't seem fresh. Also, the broccoli looked odd/weird. We were really excited and we thought it would be a big enough pizza to share and OH MY GOSH... the pizza is the size of a small pizza that you can order individually. I thought for a price of almost $13 we would have received a larger size. At Bertucci's (my favorite Pizza restaurant) you pay $18 (for just $4 more) for a large Margherita pizza. Bertucci's portion size is better and you can taste how fresh the dough and ingredients are. CPK lacked all those qualities in their pizza Oh and the bread we got seemed a little stale/store bought (definitely not fresh). We didn't eat any of the bread. Probably won't come here again- overpriced and I can find tastier pizza for a better deal.

This restaurant used to be one of my favorites... a great place to have a sit-down meal at the mall. Unfortunately it has changed over the years and is only a small piece of what it once was.  Today, i find CPK's menu too big and too expensive.  Their portions have also gotten smaller over the years. CPK seems to have gotten away from what they do best -- Pizza.  The menu has lots of other stuff, and is almost too big and too confusing. Over the years some of my favorites have been taken off the menu for no good reason. I do still like their salads... but they too are overpriced... and I have to remind myself that they really are not all that much healthier than some of the pizzas and pastas on the menu.

Many people like CPK. Many people like their pizzas. Other people hate it. They think their pizza tastes bad, and you can get better pizzas for a better deal at other restaurants. But they probably have not tried what I have tried; the menu item everyone skips over, the menu item that nobody would expect, the menu item that everyone thinks will be cliche if they see it, as it is not CPK's normal style. Their Sesame Ginger Chicken Dumplings. Now, you are probably thinking: "Dumplings at a pizza place? They can't be good!" Well, actually they are the best menu item they have! They aren't authentic chinese, exactly, but they still are very good! The rich, tender chicken is complemented by the extremely delicate pasta wrapper. I have never seen a pasta wrapper this delicate! And, to top it all off, it is drizzled with a delectable soy ginger chili sauce and topped with sesame seeds and green onions. Now, this is an appetizer, so don't expect it to fill your hunger up that much, you still need an entree. But these are such a great addition to your meal! Also, their dumplings aren't the only thing that is good there! More recently, I had my first dessert off their menu: Their butter cake! It is the best! It is a rich, tender cake served hot, with 6 pieces of whipped cream surrounding it. Plus, for a little more $$$, you can get it a la mode with vanilla ice cream, which I think is worth it. I also like their Thai Chicken Pizza, Peach Lemonade, Tuscan White Bean Hummus, and key Lime Pie. Overall, this is a great restaurant, and one of my all-time favorites!

Neomi and I ate here today and it was a pleasant surprise. I normally do not except much from a mall restaurant. We shared the two in a bowl soup, which included The Sedona  tortilla soup and the pea and barley soup mixed together like yin and yang. Each was good and together they were great. I then had the thin crust Sicilian pizza which was excellent. Neomi had a Chinese salad which she liked.

this was my first time coming here. I had the Chipotle chicken pizza, it was pretty good. There were a lot of good choices to choose from, healthy and Delicious. I would give it a try if you've never tried it. The drinks were reasonably priced as well.

I ate at this location yesterday with my two kids, and it was the worst restaurant experience I have ever had. We ordered a pizza that was a special, and asked for no cow dairy and no meat. We also ordered a pizza off the menu. The server clearly didn't know what was on the pizza, but I figured our instructions were sufficiently clear. She came back with a pizza with MAYONNAISE and CHICKEN all over it (after a thirty minute wait). She then went to talk to the kitchen and came back informing me that every item made by the restaurant contained cow dairy, including pasta and pizza crust. Bogus. After I expressed disbelief and asked for a box for the remaining half pizza that we had ordered without alterations, she went back to the kitchen to confer with the staff. Meanwhile, I took my kids to the bathroom. When I came out, our table had been moved and another family was sitting there. The server came up to me, handed me a bag with plain pasta in it and a check for $30 including tip. She acted surprised that our table had been cleared and suggested that we stay for another fifteen minutes so that they could make us another pizza, since they had thrown our leftovers away. This, after one child had not been fed, and the both had been sitting in the restaurant for 1:45. No offer to reduce the bill. In fact, I had not even been asked if I wanted the plain pasta.
I've eaten at two of their locations in the DMV, and haven't been impressed. Wouldn't go back unless I was with friends that want to eat here.

There was no host/ess available when we walked in. We sat ourself. Server saw that we sat down and was very attentive. Our server was perfectly fine and kind. She was fast and courteous. The food was good. I rated it 4 stars compared to my expectations from a pizza place in a mall. I would definitely take my family back as the food was good, fresh and they had enough choices.

Ordered food and it was inedible it was just gross. It was so damn bad that I payed the $50 bill plus tip (not the waitresses fault, she was nice) and left to go to the food court and bought sarku. I could tell they microwaved my food because the plate was piping hot and my dip had a ring of oil burnt to the sides. Shit food, don't go here.

We ordered 3 pizzas - white pizza, plain and meat pizza.  All three tasted like a frozen pizza and when we brought the pizza home everyone said "we should have ordered Dominos, Zpizza or Ledos".  There was hardly anything on it - just tasted horrible. Was going to place a large order for New Years Eve.  Glad we ordered now instead of new years eve (well sorry we ordered at all). Quesadila and Key Lime Pie was good.  Don't bother with the pizza.

My Dad and I went out to lunch. We were seated right a way but its taking time for them to get a waiter to come a serve us. From 12:30 to 1:00pm we left to go to the small food court. I guess they can't be bothered to serve there costumers.

Still solid restaurant keeps putting out its distinctive pizza.  Arriving after the Saturday night rush about 8:15, our service was prompt.  Since we sat near the rear, we watched as families emptied out, requiring some major cleaning up. The carry out was pretty busy as well. My half Chinese chicken salad was plenty big and good. DH's pepperoni, sausage pizza vanished. I had the white pizza for appetizer and he had a wedge. We both left happy.

CPK is awesome for their Kung Pao Spaghetti with shrimp!! (yummy)  and definitely their pizzas! My family and I used to come here every Sunday as a family tradition, so it was very nice to return again last night after like 8 years!!! We had great service by Tin.
DONT MISS THE MOROCCAN SALAD! SO TASTY AND HEALTHY! Frequently get their salads to take home for diner for all of us. yummy and everyone loves them. this is my fav place to eat in Mont Mall.

I had been craving CPK's pear and gorgonzola pizza (one of my all-time favorite pizzas) for weeks before I finally caved and ordered it through GrubHub (which I think was actually fulfilled through Takeout Taxi). The delivery fee was massive but I decided to treat myself. Food took awhile to arrive, but it was within the expected delivery window, so I technically can't complain about that :-). The delivery guy was older and super nice, and I sincerely hope he got the tip I entered on my credit card through Grubhub- the fact that it had to go through two companies to get to him made me a bit suspicious, and makes me think I should tip in cash in the future. Grubhub wouldn't let me select what crust we wanted for our pear and gorgonzola pizzas, so I rolled with it and left it up to fate. The crust ended up being thin crust, which I wasn't happy about (I don't like thin crust, generally). When I went to eat my pizza, one of the first things I noticed was that the crust:topping ratio was off (note: no thin crust ever again please!). The second thing I noticed was that the crust was soft, especially on the bottom, and everything on the pizza tasted slightly underdone and chewy. But simultaneously, the edges of the pizza were so crispy that if I accidentally pushed on them too hard, they broke off the slices and into little pieces. However, a few minutes in the oven at 350-400 heated the pizza up and finished cooking it. The pizza normally comes with a dressed salad on top, which they packed on the side. The salad was as I remembered, but something tasted a little off- wasn't sure if it was the dressing or slightly old and wilted lettuce (both seemed a bit off, but not sure where the taste was coming from).  The meal definitely cured my craving, but I'm not sure in the most ideal way... the meal was pretty disappointing. I suppose I'll go to this CPK in person next time the craving hits and see if it's any better than what I got delivered.

The food is good, although the manipulation from the manager ("Is your food delicious?") could go away. Good selection of choices on the menu, except for dessert. It would be nice to have lighter options (many are calorie-heavy). But overall, good food and service. But...perhaps fixing the broken toilet seat in the ladies room would be nice...

I ate here tonight and had an unusual experience. it was a Friday night and I expected it to be pretty busy. to my surprise, very empty. it was just me and I was seated right away. I am then informed that there was a power outage for nine hours and that the power had just come back on. turns out that only that side of the mall lost power. anyway, they had to get the ovens back up to temperature so the wait for pizzas would be longer than usual. slowly, the restaurant starting filling up again. I chose to stick it out and my pizza came in 45 minutes. nothing taken off my bill but my waiter was excellent and the manager came over to ask how everything was. couldn't have asked for a better experience given the circumstances and they sure will continue to get my business!

I actually like this restaurant!!! I usually order the Waldorf salad or the Chinese chicken salad which is so delicious! They used to have Singapore shrimp rolls which I would get all the time but sadly they took it off the menu :'( I never had a bad experience at this cpk location so overall 4 stars

ehhh... never went here but finally gave it a shot since me and my friend were starving after hiking and was at the mall. had the chicken fettuccini pasta and one of their thin crust pizzas and two drinks. the pasta was okayyy... so was the pizza. nothing special. the pasta was a little too sour due to the lime juice. the drinks i feel were overpriced. almost $10 for one!
I love CPK! My fav things on the menu are The BBQ chicken Chopped Salad and the Cedar Plank Salmon. The staff is super friendly and very attentive :)
My favorite casual chain. Salad with grilled peaches and pecans was awesome. Our server Nancy was great and we had 6 kids at our table!

We ordered catering for a 20 person company from CPK Bethesda. Their website clearly says that a large platter feeds 15-20 people and comes with salad or chips. It was delivered and tiny, as well as no sides or extras. When we called to ask why the order was so small, we were told that the order "is what it is" and that we wouldn't be getting a credit or refund. What customer service! The CPK employee also admitted that the "large" platter is really just 10 sandwiches cut in thirds. Ten?! That doesn't even meet the 15 that is says it feeds. We won't be ordering again. Bad CPK. Bad.

Great restaurant one of my favorite casual restaurants. I love the spinach artichoke appetizer it is outstanding also the chicken dumpling are great. I usually get the lettuce wraps with chicken as my entree (even though they are listed as an appetizer) they have great flatbreads and a good kids Mac & cheese also there pizzas are really good.  The Service is usually great I really like this I place

Was basically told I had a fake ID because it wasn't horizontal even though it says I'm 21 on the freaking thing. The server kept saying I'm under 21 but I kept telling him to look at it. He told me that after i turn 21 I would be sent a new ID. I don't know what state he lives in but in DC renewing ID costs money and I wasn't going to pay to get a new ID just to tell the world Im 21. Apparently his manager couldn't tell a real ID from a fake one. Since I've turned 21 NO-ONE has had a problem with my ID but heads up folks. if your ID isn't side ways and you want to order alcohol prepare for a big fat NOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO. Also prepare to be accused of being a minor.

I hate to give only 2 stars, as I usually LOVE CPK... I even worked here in a past life and still love the food, so, that says something.  I ordered a simple Cesar salad w/added salmon. We were in a hurry to grab a working lunch, so, we ordered ahead. When we went to pick it up, we still had to wait forever and it was not at all the same experience as you get dining in. The salad was a bit wilty and pre-packed. The salmon was so dry and portion was soooo small (for a $5 add on)! I couldn't even identify those nuggets as salmon when I opened the package! They also forgot my requested bread and utensils from the bag. Talk about disappointing!  If only I'd eaten at the restaurant, I'd have complained and I'm sure I woulda gotten a substitution item and left reasonably happy. But, no, instead, I paid dining in prices for a mediocre lunch at my desk. I'd recommend skipping the take out at this location.

My family loves California Pizza Kitchen.  Because there aren't any close to where we live, we go out of our way to eat there when we find one nearby.  We were passing through town on a drive home for the holidays and stopped here for dinner.   Most CPK locations get a 4 star rating from me.  This location things weren't firing on all cylinders.  It wasn't overly busy, but there were a couple of problems with our order.  That being said, the staff was very attentive and eager to please, and the manager stopped by to apologize for the inconvenience and didn't charge us for one of our pizzas.   Otherwise, the food was great as always at CPK.  I love their habanero carnitas pizza.

This location was ok. My pizza was good but it was a little doughy.  I got the Pepperoni, Sausage, and Mushroom Pizza.  Our waitress was nice and attentive.  Her service was admirable and quick.  However, the gentleman that sat me must have thought it was funny to put me and my friend at the area where there are steps... I had a tough time getting up the two steps while in a crutch (sprained ankle, bruised leg, numb thigh, etc...).  I managed though. It was tough getting out with the tables so close together though.  Not sure if it is or not it may or may not be ADA compliant. None the less, I'd probably come back again for a quick work lunch.

This CPK is steps below the one in Gaithersburg. Service and quality was lacking. Our server brought us wrong things. My friend ordered a Thai Crunch Salad without avocado, but he brings one with avocado. I order a glass of Beringer White Zinfandel, a white wine, but end up getting a glass of Merlot, a red wine. Since it was difficult to flag down our server, I didn't bother to change it. I just needed some wine before watching 50 Shades of Grey.  I ordered the Chicken Tequila Fettuccine, which is usually one of my favorites at CPK. This one was just okay. A lot of the fettuccine was clumped together. There is supposed to be chunks of chicken in the pasta, but here the chicken was little itty bitty pieces. CPK has a rewards program app. I had 5 dough points and asked our server about it, but he wasn't very helpful. With all these new restaurants at the mall and a renovated food court, I'd say skip this and try something different.

I arrived a little early for my lunch and my friend was really late. The service was attentive and respectful. My food was just the way I expected it. Bonus, my friend paid for lunch. They used to have chopsticks as utensils, but not anymore.

I gave one star before but now I'm giving 5 stars. Today was my 6-7 times had lunch at this restaurant. I'm very satisfied and glad to have server name Nancy. I must said that this is my only time satisfied with the service and food. She gave us little bread to eat while we waiting for our food. This has never happened before at this location. And she is deliver a fast service. I'm highly recommend her. I definitely ask for her for our server next time visit.

I ordered a delivery from CPK from Takeout Taxi.  The tortilla soup was fine, and the stuffed pepper was adequate.  The pizza was very poor--probably not even Domino's quality, except for the thin crust (extra $).  I have never seen a pizza that had so little tomato sauce that the pie was crust-colored.  What few splotches of red color came from the microscopically thin pepperoni shavings.  There were a few hyper-thin shavings of pepperoni, 3 or 4 small pieces of sausage, and 3 or 4 very thin portobello shavings ($2 extra).  My reaction when opening the box was "Are you kidding me??"  The pizza was also super salty.  To compound the matter, the pizza was sliced very indifferently (odd, seemingly random cuts, and not all the way through), so I needed to cut the pizza myself.  It seems as though CPK at this location has no attention to detail.  I will not get a pizza from them again.

Out of the two CPK's ive been to, this one falls short of the other. If you're in the moco area and looking to eat at CPK, it is worth the extra ten minute drive to the other CPK at the RIO location. Our bread was cold, my fork wasn't properly washed and still had leftover food from whoever used it last. Our waiter stopped by very frequently to ask if anything else was needed but always seemed to forget to bring whatever was requested the next time he came around. The only reason why I gave this place two stars is because of the spicy chipotle chicken pizza.
Had a delicious and surprisingly healthy meal at the Mall.  The meal was made even better by our great waiter Johnathan.

The food is decent, but I absolutely hate to see staff treated poorly by management, especially in front of customers! We had a nice waiter who was doing an excellent job, but the manager was snarky towards him...poor leadership.  Anyway, we ordered the lettuce wraps and mushroom pizza, both were pretty good. This particular location is short on staff, as we had to wait for seating, although several tables were open. It made me wonder why no one wants to work there, until I witnessed the interaction between the manager and staff.

When we went to CPK, the waitress put us at a table that had not been cleaned yet. We were fine sitting aside as she cleaned the table for us. Once we were seated we looked at the menu and realized it had been more than 10 minutes and no one had come by to serve us. We waited another 10-15 minutes and no one came, not even to ask us for our drink orders. It was my friends first time here and she will defiantly not be going again.

It wasn't bad it wasn't great.  I think honestly I'd give 2.5 stars.  The food was pretty good but the service wasn't that great.  We got there just before the dinner rush kicked in and my friend had to flag down the waitress to refill her drink.  I got the tostada pizza which was ok, I did like it because it wasn't super heavy and frankly I was still a bit filled up from my lunch.  Although comparing that Mexian style pizza to other places I've had similar CPK fell a bit short.  Next time I think I'll stick with tried and true, BBQ Chicken Pizza.

I sat at the bar today. My server was terrific. The two stars is because, who I'm assuming was the manager was so rude to her staff, it made me cringe! Get rid of her. She nearly ruined my experience.

There for dinner on a Saturday evening.  Food is good, no question there; atmosphere was horrible with clanging dishes and loud music.  When first impression of something wrong you should leave right away...  we hung in there and were sorry.

My sister and I had 1/2 salads, which were both very good. However, the music is very loud in this location, which made it impossible to have a relaxing lunch. I asked the manager if he could turn down the volume and he said he could only turn it down slightly. I was recently at the location in Palo Alto and the music was not loud like that. In addition, the service wasn't good. We had to ask for bread, which should have been brought without asking, and we had to wait a long time for our check and for our change.

I've come to CPK so many times before but this time was honestly one of the worse experiences I've had here.  Got here and had to wait 20 min for a table when there are clearly open tables. Also, while waiting, there was a party of 3 that came in asking if they had a table and they were seated right away. Ummm...what!? I'm here waiting for a table for 3 and yet another party that came in after me gets seated before me?  Our server was super nice though. Tried to add some humor to us ordering. Food quality makes up for the table arrangement but not by much. Definitely makes me wonder if I want to come back or not.

Although the food may be good, my boyfriend and I did not have a very pleasant experience with who seems to be the manager of this place. I ordered the strawberry mango cooler as my drink.  I had maybe 5-6sips of it, and it was all gone due to the cup being 2/3 filled with ice. When the waitress came over, I asked if the drink has a 'refill policy' because the cup was over filled with ice. She kindly told me that she'll get me a new drink even though it does not have a refill policy, so I thanked her. Then, a lady who seems to be the manager rudely came over to our table, didn't introduce herself and just blurted out, "you can't get refills for that drink." I told her that I never asked for a refill. I told her that the waitress kindly offered. She then said okay, but she again explained that I could not get a refill.  Even though she got me a different drink (soda), she had already ruined my night for being unnecessarily rude.

I live by Yelp ratings and I should have known better than to order from this AT BEST 2 star place. First of all, the delivery charge is ridiculous, $8.99 for delivery?! Might as well sell these nickle and dimers my freakin kidney! The food came about 1 hour and 10 minutes after ordering (rude again!) and the pizza dough was very burned! Also, we added Goat Cheese to a pizza for an extra $2.00 and they put like 3 tiny dallops of goat cheese on an entire pie of pizza. (THANK YOU YELP/EAT24 FOR PROVIDING A COUPON TO MAKE UP FOR THEIR WRONGDOING)  but anyways, the pizza was a little burned and also very cold by the time it came. What's even worse is that my fiance and I both spent a majority of the night passing it through our system! (yeah...do you really want to order from here now?!?)  Good luck if you decide to take the plunge into this bad food delivery experience..

I usually love this CPK, I live in Gaithersburg and the one at the Rio is closer but I always have issues there. I have never had issues here until last Sunday. We were seated almost immediately but it took a while for our server to come by and take our drink order. We got our  drinks and placed our order a short time later. Our waiter did not come back by to check on us we had to ask for water once our drinks had been empty for a while. I had to flag him down to get a dessert menu and again flag him down for the check. He never asked me for my Pizza Dough number and the bill was huge compared to what it normally is. I love going to CPK but I'm not sure I'll be back anytime soon. I was very disappointed in the service we received. To top it off I checked my bank account and it looks like they ran my card twice! That just really ticks me off. If I do go back to this location it will be only because of Wayne, he was not our server this time but I did see him and say hi. Wayne is wonderful he is friendly and gives great recommendations he checks in often and never leaves you wanting for anything Wayne deserves FIVE STARS!

You are getting 1 star because I overhead one of your managers say I'm ugly while I was sitting at the bar. That manager's name is Senait. She told Betty (the bartender) who then said "I know." Senait then tried to downplay my degree, told me it was hard for black people to find jobs, complained about other customers to me, and tried to boast about having a car, a job, paying her own bills, having an apartment, taking care of her kid, etc. Which btw, is very common and nothing to really boast about Senait. LoL, silly girl....Senait had it in for me and she still works there after I reported this to management. Unbelievable. I will get her fired, and I don't care how long it takes.  Just another bigoted person in the D.C. area...
The pizza here is way better than the other local locations. If your going to CPK, go to this location!

The service was perfectly fine and the Spinach Artichoke Dip was satisfactory. The California Club Pizza was, however, very disappointing to my surprise (I had the California Club Sandwich years ago and remember that was quite delicious). Simply picking up a single slice of pizza resulted in all of the toppings falling off and having to eat just pizza dough with unfavorable sauce. The pizza was overall bland and unappetizing. Other members in my group enjoyed their pizza so I'll perhaps give other flavors a chance.

The food was great... But i felt like the server was trying to rush us out when it wasnt even busy... She placed our check on our table when we werent even half way through our meal... Beside that she was very friendly and nice.

I've been to a few CPKs and this is perhaps one of the worst ones. We came here on a Friday night and after a short wait, were seated at a nice large table in a quiet corner of the restaurant. We waited about 20 minutes to be greeted by the server, and another 10-15 minutes for our drinks.  We decided to just have our order ready when the server came to give us our drinks. We ordered the Fried Mac n Cheese for an appetizer, and two pizzas for the entree. The server disappeared and did not appear again until she came with our pizzas.....40 minutes later! The appetizers never came out.  The food was decent, but even compared to other CPKs, the same pizza did not taste as good (probably a little bit overcooked). Would much rather have eaten at one of the many great food options at Montgomery Mall instead of here.
Service is great as long as it's not mobbed. The food is good but I really enjoy their seasonal options. They definitely bring variety to their regular menu.

Worst pizza I've had in a very long time.  I ordered the Tostada Pizza, which is supposed to have beans, cheese, salad, etc.  It had... let me count... fewer than 10 individual beans across the entire pizza and barely any cheese.  I basically had bread and iceberg lettuce for dinner.  I went in wanting to see the dessert menu, but left without asking for it because with the quality of the pizza, I thought I'd be disappointed in dessert.  They get 2 stars instead of 1 only because my husband liked his pasta dish.  That said, they do call themselves California PIZZA Kitchen.

First time we have ever ate at this franchise. Was crowded for Sunday lunch. Service was quick I had pizza the wife had shrimp Caesar salad. Pizza was a bit doughy but not bad. Both were good but nothing to write home about.  Service was better than the food. Solid three stars.

Love dining at this location. It's located in the mall right next to the Nordstrom and Forever 21 mall entrance. Staff here is always attentive and friendly. Stopped by recently for lunch. Ordered corn tortilla soup, BBQ chicken pizza, chips w guacamole and the lettuce wraps. Everything was delicious and came out quickly. Our bill came out to around $25. CPK has a great rewards program. They have monthly specials with $10 off of $40, gift card rewards and complimentary bday dessert. So make sure you enroll. If I'm in the area craving some pizza, pasta or something innovative I always stop here. This location has an entrance from outside the mall which makes it easier for you to enter without going all around the mall. I'll be back to try their spicy buffalo cauliflower, cocktails and there other pasta dishes.
Friendly service , delish pizza , cozy environment , nice music ... made my Sunday night delightful

Really the best that a mall has to offer in the way of franchised food. Salad is consistently excellent. And, of course, the pizza is great. Ask to sit in Drae's section. He is attentive without hovering, and is genuine in his efforts to make your dining experience better than expected.

Decided to come here for a work event (9 people). Food was terrible. Pizza was overcooked, the cheese on the pizza looked like it had been through the microwave 5 times over (bubbly and hard). Salads were good. But every single person was disappointed in their food. I've been to CPK before, and this is the worst one. If you are thinking of going here, go to Cheesecake Factory instead. Plus, the server took 30 minutes to process our checks.

I dropped in for a quick lunch with mom! I was pleased to see that they offered lunch combos. Our waiter was wonderful as was the other staff! I ordered the bbq chicken pizza and the strawberry, pecan, quinoa salad. I also ordered a specialty drink that was the combination of cranberry juice and carbonated water with a lime on the side. Perfect lunch! Obviously I couldn't finish it all but who doesn't love leftover pizza :)

Usually order pizza which is quite good. This time, however, ordered the California Club with turkey. Had this before with no complaints. Even though it tasted good I discovered that it had one thin slice of turkey covered with vegetables and lots of bacon. For what they charge for this sandwich I would expect to find a few slices of turkey. Told my server about the lack of meat and he said something about changes in food preparation. Remaining half of sandwich was replaced with another that had plenty turkey in it. My wife's Club with chicken was also quite lacking. It was also replaced.

The service was terrible. They brought the soup, appetizer, and main course at the same time. When we complained the waitress said that we had asked for her to do that and the manager supported her. We will NEVER go back to this location.

I ordered a kids cheese pizza through door dash from them and the pizza was so dry and taste like cardboard. Wasn't worth it and personally will never feed that to my children nor order from them again. It was the worst pizza I've ever ate.

We have ordered office catering from them almost every week for several months now. The food is always delicious and there is never a lapse in the quality of the food, even after delivery. The GM Joe and AGM Senait are very helpful getting the orders through, and assist us in the right amount of food to order and also explaining the catering combo options to be more price-efficient. We will continue to order from CPK Bethesda as it keeps our whole office happy! Thank you guys!

Consistently poor service compared to other locations in the chain.  Had to wait 30 minutes for our food and when it came the pizza was cold.   I could see our food sitting on the counter waiting for someone to bring it.   I finally had to track down the manager to get it delivered.  Took 10 minutes for someone to acknowledge our presence.  Not the first time we have had abysmal service at this location.  The problem seems to be systematic.

Starting with the positives. Great food. Unfortunately a major inconsistency with the bar drinks, depending on what bartender is serving that day. Some days well-prepared and delightful, other days regrettable and disappointing. Seems the drinks are being watered down.

Terrible service at dinner. Entrees arrived before our drinks. My kid's order was wrong: Hawaiian pizza instead of the BBQ Chicken he ordered; despite being a "rush order," the correct pizza took 20 minutes, by which time everyone else had finished eating. The bok choy was not properly rinsed, so sand was inside. The edge of the table was sticky, which got another kid's shirt all sticky. When the bill arrived, it included two items we had never ordered, then a subtraction of their cost as a "comp," so only the actual final amount was correct. The waitress never offered to do anything, such as comp us for the wrong pizza, despite these problems. And the manager also did nothing to try and make up for these problems, when my wife went and talked to the manager.
Had to pay extra for sauce for the bolognese that needed more. I can't stand restaurants that nickel  and dime you for stuff to make the dish better.
I absolutely love their salads! Their salmon is also delicious. The service is amazing since they always remember me. I'm avoiding dessert, but if I could have it... would definitely go for it.
Food is great. Staff was rude as hell on the phone.

California Pizza Kitchen (CPK) is a casual dining restaurant chain that specializes in California-inspired pizza. Their menu changed and was disappointed that they no longer served the Garlic Roasted Chicken. They replaced it with Lemongrass Chicken, which consisted of pan roasted Chicken in a lemongrass ginger glaze over a stir fry of baby bok choy, roasted carrots, and shiitake mushrooms. The chicken was dry. Even though we opted out the chili, the dish was still too spicy for us to enjoy. Luckily, I ordered the Original BBQ Chicken Pizza with fresh pineapples, which consisted of BBQ sauce, smoked gouda, red onions, fresh pineapples, and fresh cilantro. This pizza was delicious as usual. The pineapple slices were bigger than usual.
Very busy CP in the mall. CP is known to have a restaurant within the mall. This Bethesda restaurant is in the second floor of the mall but don't worry it is near the second floor mall parking area.

Opted for CPK for a pre-cinema meal on a busy Saturday afternoon. This is a high traffic area in the Westfield Montgomery mall so plan accordingly for your plan to park and navigate to the restaurant. My dining companion and I thought it'd be better to dine at the bar area since the wait time for tables was a long wait. The bar representative "Frans" did the damn thing! He was patient, made suggestions and ensured that he checked on us just enough so that it didn't disturb us while we dined. I enjoyed the Kung-Pao chicken spaghetti and the sangria flight. It was the first time having either and both were worthy in taste, price and portion. Weekend dining here can result in long wait times and if you have a small party (2 or less) then I'd recommend sitting at the bar for timely service. It gives a chance to see the pizzas being made and the hustle and flow of the kitchen staff delivering tasty dishes.  If in the area I would frequent again. The menu can be daunting so review it online prior to expedite a decision when you actually arrive.

This is by far the worst CPK I have ever been to. The service was fast and friendly but the dishes we were given were gross. The ice tea glass was filmy and you could actually feel grim on the outside of the glass. The spoon we were given for the sauce that came with our pizza had a visible thumb print and the small plates we were given to eat the pizza on were visibly dirty, just disgusting. The food was ok, definitely not as good as other CPKs. I wouldn't come back or recommend this place to anyone.  I feel like there are much better options in this area.

In the mall at  dinner time.  It was rush hour, and snow was falling. Staying put was the best option.   I wasn't in love with the choices, but CPK provided a better setting than the food court IMO. We went with the BBQ chicken pizza.  Decent crust, sweet tangy sauce, with smoky gouda, onion, and cilantro background.  Pretty good. I was less enthused about the cobb salad.  The bacon was chewy rather than crisp, I didn't taste the basil, the chicken had some seasoning but was a little dry. Our service fell short.  Our waiter was nice, but the water glass stood empty, and the salad with dressing on the side arrived with no dressing. On a dreary Friday evening, CPK served as damage control.

Who orders a chicken sandwich at a pizza place?  I do. Crispy chicken sandwich on the lunch menu...best chicken sandwich you'll ever get at a chain sit down restaurant. Lightly breaded and juicy as hell. Some of the Lettie on it was bad but the night on the toilet was worth it.

Terrible food. The pizza was absolutely tasteless and looked like it was from 7-Eleven. The frozen lemonade was watery.  When we walked in another customer was leaving and actually warned us not to order the pizza because it was so bad - should have listened to her. The fettuccine pasta was also terrible.
